newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil pushed higher by futures.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil pushed higher by futures.

text.p: NWE gas oil ended higher on Thursday as benchmark IPE futures surged toward the $200 a tonne mark and traders tested firmer premiums.
Sept IPE closed $5 higher at $196.75, spurred mainly by concerns over low gas oil stocks in the U.S. and Europe.

On the cargo market, two low sulphur cargoes traded at Oct IPE +$15, cif Le Havre for second half September delivery and traders said there was still considerable interest from French refiners for 0.05 percent material.
A French refiner was also heard bidding for GOM at Sept IPE +$6.50, cif Le Havre.
There was also talk of stronger German heating oil cargo premiums at Sept IPE +$4.50/+$5.0, cif Hamburg, for Sept 10-20 delivery but no deals were reported.
"There's definitely strong German interest but these premiums seem pretty high," one trader said.
On the Russian side, traders said cargoes were scarce. Traders premiums for first half September delivery were being bid at roughly Sept +1, but no offers were heard.
